page.title: 08LOCAL LANGUAGE-FAZAKERLEY
page.content: Have you a phrase or saying of local flavour-fact,humour,grumble or slogan? Some responses obtained, without further comment:-{Children}My school is cool, my school is fab, my school is in Fazakerley. I knock for my mates and see if they are coming out. Take a long walk off a short pier.{Adults} Many calls - few get answered. I'm skint, Giz a job. Go for a blow. Going for a kip. He was standing there like one of Lewis's. When you walk through a storm hold your head up high. Mind the bugs don't bite. If you fall and break your legs don't come running for me.Bring a tear to a glass eye.{Senior {Citizens}The state of her and the price of fish. You couldn't hit a door if you had hold of the knob.He's got a face like the back of a cab and it's not even Hansom. In they go on Monday, out they come on Friday.
